title: Change community join flow to always ask for sharing addresses

milestone.description:
Priorities **in priority order** for the 0.13 milestone:

**1. Finish items started in 0.12**
- Complete any outstanding issues related to pairing (for syncing) - Igor
- Implement the 'Admin' role (issue #10114) - Mykhailo
- Any remaining work to pay off tech. debt related to mutual contacts - Mishka
- When creating/editing token based permission, ability to search for and selecting Collectables from OpenSea - MichaelC

**2. Channel token permissions**
- Create, edit and delete channel token permissions in the permissions admin screens
- This includes the "no tokens required to view this channel" permission
- All user facing channel token permissions functionality e.g. what happens when a user tries to access a token gated channel they don't have the required tokens to access, what happens when a user only has permissions to view a channel, etc...
- If a community is an open (not token gated at the community level) community, if a channel is token gated AND if **no** "no tokens required to view this channel" permission for that channel exists, then the channel should be automatically encrypted.  If token gating is removed from a channel, the channel should become unencrypted.

**3. DB perf improvements**
- https://www.notion.so/Database-related-performance-1dbaa7ea894c461d885e55676683be07
- Alex and Patryk to work on this, with help from Lukáš

**4. Update app to use new 'Share URL' formats**
- add functionality to status-go to generate the new 'Share URL' formats for sharing links to: User Profiles, Communities, Channel inside a Community (issue https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10851)
- Update everywhere a user can share a URL from to use the new URL format (issue https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10852)
- New/updated URL unroll designs for inside chat, including specific unrolls for the new User Profile, Community and Channel inside a Community URLs (issue https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10585)
- Ability to share a URL that points to a specific channel in a community (issue #10160)
- Update all address inputs to accept a user pasting a 'share URL' into the input (in addition to being able to input the raw address).  This includes: Start new chat input, send contact request input in Settings, the import community key input, etc...
- Update Status Desktops URL handler so that if Status is installed on a computer, when a user clicks on a Status 'Share URL' the app is launched (if not already running) and after signing in the user is automatically taken to the entity the Share URL represented inside the app.  e.g. if a user clicks on a URL for a Status Community, the user should be taken to the home screen for that community inside the Status App

**5. Mint Assets functionality**
- Also includes some small improvements to the mint Collectables functionality
- Noelia, GravityBlast

**6. Profile showcase backend**


**--- For the Wallet team ---**
tldr; continue building out Ben's wallet designs

1. Complete any outstanding development related to the activity screens
2. All accounts overview screens
3. New settings screens
4. Implement 'imported key and account' syncing and transfer between devices

body:
### Description

As discovered when working on the community airdrop feature, to airdrop tokens to users in a community, we need their wallet address.

However, currently, users only share their addresses when the community already has a permission. In the airdrop use case, most of the time, the community will start with no permission and then the permission will be created for certain channels or for admins, using the airdrop feature.

Therefore, the temporary solution is to **always** ask users to share their wallet address when joining any community.

The flow is already there for permissioned communities, we just need to expand it to those without permissions as well.

In the case of a community with no permission, the spectate screen stays the same, but when the user clicks on the "Join the community" button, they will instead see the popup that asks for them to share their address, regardless of it being on request or not.
Figma: https://www.figma.com/file/17fc13UBFvInrLgNUKJJg5/Kuba%E2%8E%9CDesktop?type=design&node-id=2244-260547&t=FFyigg7zVGKkn0sX-0
(ignore the captcha)
It's possible that this popup is already implemented and can be reused from the permissioned community flow.

**Additional info**
We now use a new mechanism for sharing the address that adds the needed chainIDs to check the tokens for the owner, but since there is no permission yet, ie no balance to check, you can make it so it shares no chainID for now.

Then, if the owner adds a permission, it would be the owner's responsibility to check all of Status' known chains and create the chainID array to fulfill the new permissions.
@0x-r4bbit can you confirm if the mechanism is already working like this where the control node will check all chains if the user has no chainID set yet? 

### Acceptance Criteria

- All communities ask to reveal addresses
- The control node aggregates those addresses, same as for a permissioned community 
- If a community becomes permissioned after that, the user's address is able to be checked. The is kicked or kept depending on whether they possess the tokens
- Stays backwards compatible with old communities
  - For example, the Status CC community should not encounter any problem even if the users didn't share their address
  - ie even if we ask new communities to share address all the time, old communities with no addresses should still work as intended.

Adding some addition info here:

### Status Desktop

First of all, extending the no-permission-community case should be as simple as changing

https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/blob/0b280f090e8b01db75c97ffabde543dd6e8e0143/ui/app/AppLayouts/Chat/views/CommunityColumnView.qml#L101-L104

with 

https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/blob/0b280f090e8b01db75c97ffabde543dd6e8e0143/ui/app/AppLayouts/Chat/ChatLayout.qml#L90-L92

`requestToJoinCommunityWithAuthentication()` automatically spins up the authentication modal provided by the keycard module. After entering a password and confirming, this should then trigger 

https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/blob/0b280f090e8b01db75c97ffabde543dd6e8e0143/src/app/modules/main/chat_section/module.nim#L859-L860

which will ultimately perform an async request-to-join using the provided password.

The provided password is what makes the difference here. When status-go's `RequestToJoinCommunity()` is called and its arguments include a `password`, it will automatically try to unlock the user accounts keystore using that password and verify the unlocked accounts. For each account, a signature is then created (using its private key), and both are then attached to the `RequestToJoin` message which will be sent to the network.

The owner node will then check those accounts accordingly for ownership and necessary funds.

### status-go

> We now use a new mechanism for sharing the address that adds the needed chainIDs to check the tokens for the owner, but since there is no permission yet, ie no balance to check, you can make it so it shares no chainID for now.

Minor correction here: 

Adding the chainIDs to the accounts has not landed in status-go yet and is current being refactored. Once the refactor is done, if the community was a token-permission-community, then we'd obtain a list of wallet + chainID combinations during the process of creating the request to join message. **Again this is being worked on right now** so at the moment, there'll be checks on all supported chains by the owner node.

However, since we're dealing with a community that does **not** have permissions, status-go is simply ignoring the attached accounts at the moment. This needs change.

This is the code that checks the wallet addresses if the community in question has `BECOME_MEMBER` permissions. Notice that all of this is ignore if there aren't any such permissions. So to make this work, we'll have to move the conditions around a bit, and also ensure that we **don't** mark the request as declined/reject it mistakenly. 

https://github.com/status-im/status-go/blob/15d2b4fe80d256dc0ee599174d1e30161381c589/protocol/communities/manager.go#L1511-L1582

Then, regarding

> Then, if the owner adds a permission, it would be the owner's responsibility to check all of Status' known chains and create the chainID array to fulfill the new permissions.

As for now, the owner will not actually figure out the chainIDs for other users. It's the users responsibility to provide chain IDs to check on. So if we move from a non-permission to a permission- community, then all existing members will be considered invalid. But since we will have an API that checks on all chains, we could make it a special case for when we move from 0 to > 0 permissions.

So only in **that** case, the owner node makes the effort to checks on all chains for all members and trying to figure out all chain IDs.

@0x-r4bbit @jrainvilleI just want to clarify the requirements: This request should be accepted automatically on community's owner status-go side?

https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/assets/2522130/deaedee3-8f86-4cca-bb70-6ba0165a2041

@MishkaRogachev depends if it's a community that has the "Request to join required" flag set or not.
If yes, then the admin has to manually approve all incoming requests (this has nothing to do with token permissions btw)

Indeed, what Pascal said is correct.

The presence of permissions or not is not relevant to the approval by the owner. Only the "Request to join required" setting here 
![image](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/assets/11926403/f090da20-7d13-4809-87af-604da834fad6)
